summary: This bill, the Leech Lake Reservation Restoration Amendments Act of 2025, aims to amend the original act to provide for the transfer of additional federal land in the Chippewa National Forest in Cass County, Minnesota, to the Leech Lake Band of Ojibwe. It addresses land identification, survey completion, and potential land substitutions through agreements between the Secretary and the Tribe. The bill also reaffirms the applicability of Minnesota statutes regarding hunting and fishing rights and mandates public engagement during the implementation of the amendments.
